number.description:
Data Type: number
Description: A number is a single numerical value.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of this field.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: A number is a single numerical value.
examples.name: ParticleCount
Gravitational Constant Precision
examples.description: A precise measurement of the gravitational constant in a new study.

examples.name: ParticleCount
examples.description: The total number of detected particles in a given volume of air, measured in a cleanroom environment during a controlled experiment.

number_list.description:
Data Type: number_list
Description: A number_list is a list of numbers.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of this field.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: A number_list is a list of numbers representing the varying temperature readings (in Celsius) from a week-long environmental study on a remote island.
examples.name: Temperature Readings
SeismicWaveFrequencies
examples.description: List of frequencies, in Hertz, detected by seismographs during an earthquake event.

examples.name: Sample Sizes in Clinical Trials
examples.description: A list of sample sizes for each arm of a multi-arm clinical trial studying the effects of three new treatments compared to a placebo.

unit_number.description:
Data Type: unit_number
Description: A unit_number is a single number with a prescribed unit. Only use this type if the value is likely to have a known unit, conversions are not easy so select a unit that is most likely to be used.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of this field.
  - unit (string): The unit that this number will likely have.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: light_intensity
examples.description: The intensity of light at a particular location measured in lumens.

examples.name: stellar_luminosity
examples.description: The total amount of energy emitted by a star per unit time

examples.name: atmospheric_pressure
examples.description: The pressure of the atmosphere at a specific location measured in hectopascals.

unit_number_list.description:
Data Type: unit_number_list
Description: A unit_number_list is a list of numbers with a prescribed unit. Only use this type if the value is likely to have a known unit, conversions are not easy so select a unit that is most likely to be used.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of this field.
  - unit (string): The unit that this number will likely have.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: List of heights of newly discovered species of trees in a tropical forest.
examples.name: Tropical Tree Heights
Average Molecular Weights
examples.description: List of average molecular weights of different proteins identified in a study.

examples.name: Atmospheric CO2 Concentrations
examples.description: List of atmospheric CO2 concentrations over the last decade, measured annually.

fraction.description:
Data Type: fraction
Description: A fraction is a numerator and a denominator.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of this field.
  - numerator (number): The numerator of the fraction.
  - denominator (number): The denominator of the fraction.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: photosynthesis efficiency
examples.description: Represents the efficiency of photosynthesis as the ration of consumed CO2 to produced O2 in plants.

examples.name: ConcentrationRatio
examples.description: The fraction representing the concentration of a substance in a solution.

examples.name: GeneExpressionRatio
examples.description: Represents the ratio of gene expression under treatment compared to control conditions.

categorical_value.description:
Data Type: categorical_value
Description: A categorical value is used to extract data that falls into predefined categories, such as types of diseases, genres of literature, or classifications of artifacts.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the category.
  - categories (array): A list of possible categories.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: The category of the element based on its group in the periodic table.
examples.name: Element Category

examples.description: Classification of astronomical objects based on their predominant location and nature.
examples.name: Astronomical Object Classification
Planet Classification
examples.description: The classification of a celestial body based on its characteristics, such as composition and orbit.

lat_lon_pair.description:
Data Type: lat_lon_pair
Description: A coordinate pair extracts geographical or spatial data points, such as locations on a map or positions in a spatial experiment.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what the coordinates represent.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: The exact geographic location of the discovered underwater volcano near the Mariana Trench.
examples.name: Underwater Volcano Coordination
Experimental Site Location
examples.description: The exact geographic location of the experimental site where a novel, sustainable crop cultivation practice is being tested.

examples.name: ResearchSiteLocation
examples.description: Coordinates marking the primary site of a conservation research study in the Amazon rainforest.

lat_lon_pair_list.description:
Data Type: lat_lon_pair_list
Description: A list of coordinate pairs extracts geographical or spatial data points, such as locations on a map or positions in a spatial experiment.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what the coordinates represent.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: experimental_sites
examples.description: Coordinates for the locations of a series of experimental agricultural sites designed to test various climate adaptation strategies in crops.

examples.name: MigrationPath
examples.description: Coordinates representing the annual migration path of the Arctic tern, the longest known annual migration in the animal kingdom.

examples.name: MigrationRoutes
examples.description: The migratory paths of the monarch butterfly across North America, highlighting key stopover locations.

date.description:
Data Type: date
Description: A date is a specific point in time, such as a birthday, a historical event, or a deadline.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the date.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: Launch date of the first manned mission to Mars, marking a monumental step in space exploration and human history.
examples.name: MarsMissionLaunchDate
DiscoveryDate
examples.description: The date when the Higgs boson particle was first observed at CERN.

examples.name: Discovery of Penicillin Date
examples.description: The date when Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin, marking a major advancement in medical science.

date_list.description:
Data Type: date_list
Description: A list of dates is a collection of specific points in time, such as birthdays, historical events, or deadlines.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the dates.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: A list of significant milestones in the development of quantum computing, marking notable discoveries and the introduction of groundbreaking algorithms.
examples.name: Quantum Computing Milestones

examples.description: Important dates in the discovery of DNA structure including the publication of Watson and Crick's paper and the award of the Nobel Prize.
examples.name: DNA_Discovery_Important_Dates
Discovery Milestones
examples.description: Key dates marking significant discoveries in the field of quantum computing

text_block.description:
Data Type: text_block
Description: A block of text, typically a paragraph or a set of paragraphs, used to extract larger narrative sections.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the content to be extracted.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: Research Findings
examples.description: A detailed description of the scientific findings, including key observations, results, and conclusions drawn from the research study.

examples.name: Discovery Summary
examples.description: A detailed summary of the scientific discovery, including the hypothesis, research method, key findings, and conclusions. This text block should encapsulate the essence of the discovery in a narrative form, suitable for a lay audience while retaining scientific accuracy.

examples.name: Study Summary
examples.description: A comprehensive summary of the research findings, methodologies, and implications. This may include key data points, the significance of the research, and future directions for study.

boolean_value.description:
Data Type: boolean_value
Description: A true or false value often used to answer yes/no questions or confirm the presence or absence of a feature.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of this field.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: Indicates if the research study was conducted in a controlled laboratory environment.
examples.name: IsLabEnvironment
IsGeneticallyModified
examples.description: Indicates if the organism has undergone genetic modifications.

examples.name: hasAntiGravityMaterial
examples.description: Indicates whether the material under study exhibits anti-gravity properties under specific conditions.

range_value.description:
Data Type: range_value
Description: A range value specifies a minimum and maximum of a measurable quantity, useful for extracting data where a span is significant, such as temperature ranges, age groups, or measurement tolerances.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what the range represents.
  - unit (string): The unit of measurement for the range values.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.description: Temperature range at which the chemical reaction becomes most efficient
examples.name: Optimal Reaction Temperature
Optimal Growth Temperature
examples.description: The temperature range within which a specific microorganism exhibits optimal growth.

examples.name: Optimal Growth Temperature
examples.description: The optimal temperature range for the growth of a newly discovered extremophile microorganism.

effect_estimate.description:
Data Type: effect_estimate
Description: An effect estimate captures a statistical measure of association (hazard ratio, odds ratio, risk ratio, incidence rate ratio, mean difference, etc.) with its confidence interval and p-value. Use for single comparisons like 'HR = 1.52 (95% CI: 1.12-2.08), p = 0.008'.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what effect is being estimated and the comparison being made.
  - effect_type (string): The type of effect measure (e.g., HR, OR, RR, IRR, MD, SMD, beta).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: effect_estimate
examples.description: Incidence rate ratio of developing acute lung inflammation among workers exposed to aerosolized nanoparticles compared to unexposed controls

examples.name: effect_estimate
examples.description: Odds ratio for remission in patients receiving the novel monoclonal antibody therapy versus placebo

examples.name: effect_estimate
examples.description: Mean difference in systolic blood pressure reduction between participants following the low-sodium DASH diet and those on a standard diet

effect_estimate_list.description:
Data Type: effect_estimate_list
Description: A list of effect estimates for multiple comparisons or groups. Use when extracting multiple HRs, ORs, etc. from the same analysis (e.g., multiple exposure levels vs reference).
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what effects are being estimated.
  - effect_type (string): The type of effect measure (e.g., HR, OR, RR, IRR, MD, SMD, beta).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: effect_estimate_list
examples.description: Hazard ratios for different doses of a novel immunotherapy compared to placebo over a 12-month follow-up.

examples.name: env_exposure_ORs
examples.description: Odds ratios for developing asthma across quartiles of long-term air pollutant exposure compared to the lowest quartile.

examples.name: dose_response_RRs
examples.description: Relative risks of cardiovascular events at incremental plasma cholesterol lowering by statin therapy versus placebo across three reduction tiers.

measurement_with_error.description:
Data Type: measurement_with_error
Description: A measurement with associated uncertainty/error, such as '15.3 ± 2.1 mm' or '42.5 (SE: 3.2)'. Use for single measurements with standard deviation, standard error, or other error terms.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what is being measured.
  - unit (string): The unit of measurement.
  - error_type (string): The type of error (SD, SE, 95% CI, IQR, range).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: mean_neuron_firing_rate
examples.description: Average firing rate of hippocampal neurons during maze navigation

examples.name: spectral_absorbance_peak
examples.description: Peak wavelength absorbance of engineered fluorescent protein under UV excitation

examples.name: particle_diameter_distribution
examples.description: Average diameter of synthesized polymer nanoparticles

measurement_with_error_list.description:
Data Type: measurement_with_error_list
Description: A list of measurements with associated uncertainty/error. Use when extracting multiple measurements with their error terms.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what is being measured.
  - unit (string): The unit of measurement.
  - error_type (string): The type of error (SD, SE, 95% CI, IQR, range).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: enzyme_activity_rates
examples.description: Measured rates of enzyme-catalyzed reactions under varied temperature conditions

examples.name: soil_nitrogen_concentration_series
examples.description: Serial measurements of soil nitrate concentration in agricultural plots across growth season

examples.name: atmospheric_co2_readings
examples.description: Hourly atmospheric CO2 concentration measurements at urban monitoring station

sample_statistics.description:
Data Type: sample_statistics
Description: Descriptive statistics for a sample including count, central tendency, and spread. Use for extracting summary statistics like 'n=42, mean 15.3 (SD 2.1)' or 'n=50, median 12 (IQR 8-16)'.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the sample and what is being measured.
  - unit (string): The unit of measurement for the variable.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: Postoperative Pain Scores
examples.description: Descriptive statistics of patient‐reported pain levels in the first 24 hours after laparoscopic cholecystectomy

examples.name: Vegetation Chlorophyll Content
examples.description: Descriptive statistics of foliar chlorophyll concentration in leaves sampled from urban maple trees

examples.name: Soil Microbial Biomass
examples.description: Summary of microbial biomass carbon in agricultural soil samples after compost amendment

sample_statistics_list.description:
Data Type: sample_statistics_list
Description: A list of sample statistics for multiple groups or variables. Use when extracting summary statistics across multiple groups (e.g., treatment vs control).
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what is being measured across groups.
  - unit (string): The unit of measurement.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: sample_statistics_list
examples.description: Comparison of systolic blood pressure readings between intervention and control groups at 6-month follow-up

examples.name: sample_statistics_list
examples.description: Mean concentrations of airborne particulate matter (PM2.5) in urban, suburban, and rural sampling sites over 24-hour periods

examples.name: sample_statistics_list
examples.description: Baseline and 12-month follow-up serum cholesterol levels across diet intervention, exercise intervention, and combined intervention groups

regression_coefficient.description:
Data Type: regression_coefficient
Description: A regression coefficient with standard error, confidence interval, and p-value. Use for extracting beta coefficients from linear, logistic, or other regression models.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the predictor variable and outcome.
  - coefficient_type (string): The type of coefficient (beta, B, log-odds, etc.).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: regression_coefficient
examples.description: Association between daily high-intensity interval training and systolic blood pressure reduction over 12 weeks

examples.name: coeff_smoking
examples.description: Effect of cigarette smoking frequency on log-odds of developing chronic bronchitis

examples.name: bmi_weight_interaction
examples.description: Interaction term between BMI and physical activity level predicting insulin sensitivity index

regression_coefficient_list.description:
Data Type: regression_coefficient_list
Description: A list of regression coefficients from a model. Use when extracting multiple predictors from the same regression analysis.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the regression model and outcome.
  - coefficient_type (string): The type of coefficient (beta, B, log-odds, etc.).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: regression_coefficient_list
examples.description: Multivariate linear regression predicting systolic blood pressure reduction (mmHg) at 6 months based on baseline characteristics and treatment adherence

examples.name: regression_coefficient_list
examples.description: Logistic regression model predicting 30-day readmission risk among heart failure patients based on demographic, clinical, and lab variables

examples.name: regression_coefficient_list
examples.description: Cox proportional hazards regression assessing hazard ratios for mortality in patients with metastatic melanoma under immunotherapy, adjusting for age, sex, and tumor burden

statistical_test.description:
Data Type: statistical_test
Description: A statistical test result including test statistic, degrees of freedom, and p-value. Use for chi-square, t-tests, F-tests, ANOVA, etc.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what is being tested.
  - test_type (string): The type of statistical test (chi-square, t-test, F-test, Mann-Whitney, etc.).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: statistical_test
examples.description: Comparison of average viral load reduction between treatment and control groups in an HIV study.

examples.name: statistical_test
examples.description: ANOVA to assess differences in photosynthetic efficiency across three algal species under varying light intensities.

examples.name: statistical_test
examples.description: Mann-Whitney test comparing median soil moisture levels between irrigated and non-irrigated plots.

contingency_table_2x2.description:
Data Type: contingency_table_2x2
Description: A 2x2 contingency table for binary exposure and binary outcome. Use for extracting data needed for odds ratios, risk ratios, chi-square tests. Cells are: [exposed+outcome, exposed+no_outcome, unexposed+outcome, unexposed+no_outcome].
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the exposure and outcome being cross-tabulated.
  - exposure_label (string): Label for the exposure/row variable.
  - outcome_label (string): Label for the outcome/column variable.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: hfcs_nash_2x2
examples.description: Association between high fructose corn syrup (HFCS) consumption and nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) development in adults.

examples.name: pesticide_parkinson_2x2
examples.description: Relationship between occupational pesticide exposure and Parkinson's disease occurrence among agricultural workers.

examples.name: uv_exposure_skincancer_2x2
examples.description: Cross-tabulation of chronic UV radiation exposure and incidence of basal cell skin carcinoma in lifeguards.

named_number_set.description:
Data Type: named_number_set
Description: A flexible set of related named numbers extracted together from the same source. Use when you need to extract multiple related numeric values that don't fit standard statistical patterns, such as study characteristics, multiple time points, or custom metrics. Specify the expected field names in the description.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): Description including the names and meanings of each number to extract (e.g., 'Extract: follow_up_months, total_n, dropout_n, completion_rate').
  - field_names (array): List of field names to extract (e.g., ['follow_up_months', 'total_n', 'dropout_n']).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: tumor_growth_metrics
examples.description: Extract: baseline_volume_mm3, mid_treatment_volume_mm3, post_treatment_volume_mm3, relative_volume_change_percent

examples.name: cognitive_performance_scores
examples.description: Extract: pre_intervention_score, post_intervention_score, one_month_followup_score, score_change_absolute

examples.name: vascular_resistance_parameters
examples.description: Extract: baseline_resistance_dyn_s_cm5, peak_exercise_resistance_dyn_s_cm5, post_exercise_recovery_resistance_dyn_s_cm5, resistance_reduction_percentage

proportion_with_ci.description:
Data Type: proportion_with_ci
Description: A proportion or percentage with confidence interval. Use for prevalence, incidence rates, or any percentage with uncertainty bounds.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of what proportion is being reported.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: Hypertension_prevalence_in_adults
examples.description: Prevalence of hypertension among adults aged 40–60 years in urban settings over a 12-month period (95% CI).

examples.name: Diabetes_incidence_rate
examples.description: Annual incidence rate of type 2 diabetes among individuals with BMI ≥30 in suburban populations (95% CI).

examples.name: Vaccine_efficacy_in_elderly
examples.description: Proportionate reduction in symptomatic influenza cases among elderly participants after vaccination (95% CI).

survival_analysis_result.description:
Data Type: survival_analysis_result
Description: Results from survival/time-to-event analysis including median survival, rates at specific time points, and comparison statistics. Use for Kaplan-Meier, Cox regression summaries.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the survival outcome and groups being compared.
  - time_unit (string): Unit of time for survival analysis (days, months, years).
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: Postoperative Overall Survival
examples.description: Comparison of overall survival after HepatoCellular Carcinoma resection between patients receiving adjuvant immunotherapy vs. standard care

examples.name: Disease-Free Survival
examples.description: Time to recurrence comparison between hormone therapy group and placebo after mastectomy in early-stage breast cancer

examples.name: Progression-Free Survival
examples.description: Kaplan-Meier analysis comparing PFS between novel tyrosine kinase inhibitor and standard chemotherapy in advanced non-small cell lung cancer

text_block_list.description:
Data Type: text_block_list
Description: A list of text blocks, used to extract multiple narrative sections or related text segments.
Specifications Required:
  - name (string): The name of this field.
  - description (string): A description of the content to be extracted.
  - required (boolean): Is this field required?

examples.name: text_block_list
examples.description: A list of text blocks, used to extract multiple narrative sections or related text segments from a research paper.

examples.name: key_text_sections
examples.description: Multiple narrative passages such as study background, methodology summary, and discussion highlights to capture distinct text segments.

examples.name: text_block_list
examples.description: A list of text blocks, used to extract multiple narrative sections or related text segments.
